alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Laurens; Southern Spartanburg; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:36AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Laurens, central Spartanburg, western Cherokee and northwestern Union Counties through 800 AM EST... At 736 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles south of Spartanburg, or near Roebuck, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Woodruff, Pacolet, Cowpens, Roebuck, Jonesville, Pacolet Mills, Croft State Park, Moore and Cedar Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Conditions are favorable for development of a very brief, weak tornado. Be prepared to take immediate action if a tornado is sighted or a Tornado Warning is issued.
